title: Calories in 4 Ounces of Salmon
meta_description: Discover calories in 4 ounces of salmon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Atlantic salmon fillet, cooked (baked or grilled), skinless, no added oil, salt, or seasonings; 4 oz â‰ˆ 113 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by salmon type (wild vs. farmed), cut, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: 4 ounces of cooked salmon offers about 233 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 4 ounces of cooked salmon?
faqs.a: Approximately 233 kcal for cooked, skinless Atlantic salmon.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 4 oz salmon?

faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked salmon.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in salmon?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling keeps calories lower; frying with oil adds 40+ kcal per tsp.
Wild is leaner (~180 kcal/100g) vs. farmed (~206 kcal/100g); adjust based on type.
